title: Redding News | Times-tribune | Maryville Forum
text: REDDING, Iowa — Condolences are sent out to the family and friends of Oney Brumfield who died on Monday the 24th. Her services were to be held on Tuesday, April 1, in Mount Ayr with burial in the Gravity cemetery. Sympathy is also extended to the family of Charles Coulter, husband of Isabelle Abarr of the Kansas City area. His death was on Monday the 24th. Charles Abarr went to his visitation on Sunday in Kansas City and to the funeral on Monday, March 31. Andy Abarr and granddaughter Elizabeth, of Oklahoma City, and Weldon and Pam Abarr from Boone were also present at the visitation and funeral services. Dean Olney took Helen Combs to her eye appointment on Wednesday in Creston. Linda Hosfield, Cindy Snethen and Bobbi Bainum went to a bridal shower for BayLee Darrah on Sunday in Grant City. Connie Allen called on Gladys Jones on Tuesday and again on Thursday and helped her with work. On Saturday, John Jones from Mount Ayr visited with Gladys. Joseph Tamburrino, grandson of Kelly and Bob Nolin, visited them Thursday through Sunday. Joseph is from Council Bluffs. Peggy Overholser attended the bridal shower for her granddaughter, BayLee Darrah, Sunday afternoon at the Grant City golf club house. Dan and Kathy Quick visited Berta Quick at Clearview and Dorothy Barber at Heritage Park during the week. Ginny Quick visited with Berta Quick at Clearview during the week. Ginny went to the school play at the high school on Thursday and Friday. Ginny’s weekend visitors were Rebecca and Kaden Smith, Calvin Main, Louden Main and Alaina Doolittle. Bobbi Bainum visited with Lena Hunt and Ian Hargrave on Saturday.
